FDG.function_description: Task management with category filtering and task creation

core_logic.logic: The user navigates to the Tasks view. From there, category filtering (via tabs like All, Work, etc.) and task creation (via the + button) can be done, though the provided action only shows the initial navigation to the Tasks view.

steps.summary: Navigate to the Tasks view

FDG.function_description: Displays tasks filtered by the 'All' category (or current selected category), shows a message if no tasks exist in the category, and provides an option to create a new task.

core_logic.logic: The app starts on the tasks page. First, it filters tasks by the 'All' category (or the currently selected category). Then, it checks if there are tasks in that category: if there are, it displays them; if not, it shows a message indicating no tasks exist. Finally, it provides a '+' button to create a new task (though the 'create' action's step isn't in the provided actions yet, the filtering and check are captured here with the given action).

steps.summary: Filter tasks by 'All' category (or current selected category)

FDG.function_description: Displays tasks filtered by the 'All' category (currently showing no tasks) and provides an option to create a new task via the '+' button, along with category tabs for task filtering and a new user offer banner.

core_logic.logic: The app starts on a page showing task categories (All, Work, Personal, Wishlist) and a new user offer banner. The main flow is a straight line: when the 'Work' category tab is clicked, the app filters tasks to show only those in the 'Work' category (currently showing no tasks in this category).

steps.summary: Click 'Work' category tab to filter tasks

FDG.function_description: Displays tasks filtered by the 'All' category (currently showing no tasks in the 'Wishlist' sub - category) and provides an option to create a new task.

core_logic.logic: The app starts on a page showing the 'Wishlist' category with no tasks. The core logic involves filtering tasks by the 'Personal' category (though the initial state is 'Wishlist' with no tasks) and having an option to create a new task (via the '+' button, not in the provided action but implied by the UI). The provided action is clicking to filter by 'Personal', but the main flow here is about the 'All' and 'Wishlist' context: initially, 'Wishlist' has no tasks, and there's a way to create a new task. However, with the given action, the step is to click to filter by 'Personal' (maybe part of exploring categories, but the functional point is about 'All' and 'Wishlist' showing no tasks and new task option). Wait, the provided action is [0,2] with description 'Filter tasks by 'Personal' category'. So the step is to click to filter by 'Personal' category. The logic: The app displays tasks in categories. The 'Wishlist' sub - category (under 'All' context) has no tasks. The user can filter tasks by the 'Personal' category (via the provided click action) and also has the option to create a new task (via the '+' button visible in the UI).

steps.summary: Click to filter tasks by 'Personal' category

FDG.function_description: Displays tasks filtered by the 'All' category (currently showing no tasks in the 'Wishlist' sub - category here, but the main function is to show tasks under the 'All' filter) and provides an option to create a new task.

The current page provides additional task - related options such as managing categories, searching tasks, sorting tasks, printing tasks, toggling subtask visibility, and upgrading to PRO, while also indicating no tasks in the “Wishlist” category and offering a way to create a task.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the page showing the 'Wishlist' category with no tasks. The user clicks the additional options menu (three dots) to open a dropdown with task - related actions like managing categories, searching, sorting, printing, toggling subtasks, and upgrading to PRO. There are no branches or loops as it's a single action to open the options.

steps.summary: Click the three - dot menu to open additional task - related options

FDG.function_description: The current page allows users to input details for a new task (with the "Wishlist" category pre - selected) and provides options to set additional task - related details (like date, etc.) before submitting the task creation.

core_logic.logic: The process starts by clicking to begin creating a new task. Then, the user inputs the task details (e.g., 'Buy concert tickets') into the text field. Finally, the user clicks the submission button to complete the task creation, with the 'Wishlist' category pre - selected throughout.

steps.summary: Initiate new task creation
Enter task details
Submit the new task

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to create a new task within the "Wishlist" category by entering task details in the input field and optionally setting additional attributes (like date, recurrence, or priority) before submitting.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Wishlist task page (with no tasks). They click the 'Add a new task' button (the + icon) to open the task input interface. This action transitions to the page where task details can be entered, initiating the task creation process for the Wishlist category.

steps.summary: Click the 'Add a new task' button (the + icon) to open the task input interface.

FDG.function_description: The current page (side navigation menu of the To-Do List app) provides access to various app - related features and options such as viewing a new user sale, accessing starred tasks, managing categories, customizing the theme, configuring widgets, getting help via FAQ, providing feedback, following the app on social media, donating, exploring family apps, and adjusting settings.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking to open the side navigation menu. Once the menu is open, the user can then choose from various options like New User Sale, Starred Tasks, Category management, Theme customization, Widget configuration, FAQ, Feedback, Follow Us, Donate, Family Apps, or Settings, with no branching or looping in this initial step of opening the menu.

steps.summary: Click to open the side navigation menu

FDG.function_description: The Calendar page allows users to view the monthly calendar (December 2025 here) and provides an option to create a new task by clicking the "+" button, enabling clear day - planning through the calendar view.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the initial page and clicks to navigate to the Calendar view (showing December 2025). Then, the user can click on a specific calendar date (e.g., December 30) to potentially plan tasks for that day, with an option to create a new task via the '+' button.

steps.summary: Navigate to Calendar view (December 2025)
Click on calendar date (December 30)

FDG.function_description: The "Mine" page provides a personalized overview of task progress, including completed/pending task counts, daily task completion trends, upcoming tasks, and pending tasks by category, along with a prompt to log in and a new user sale promotion.
data_in: pending tasks in categories time range setting
data_out: pending tasks in categories time range options (dropdown opened)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to the 'Mine' page (S1). Once on the 'Mine' page, a branch point (S2) appears for interacting with the time range dropdown, allowing selection of different time ranges (e.g., 'In 30 days', 'In 7 days', 'All') to view pending tasks by category (S3).

steps.summary: Navigate to the 'Mine' view
Interact with the time range dropdown
View pending tasks by the selected time range

FDG.function_description: The current page is a subscription purchase screen for the to - do list app, which showcases the PRO features (like unlimited checklists, repetitive task customization, etc.), offers different subscription plans (Monthly, Permanent, Annual), has a limited - time special offer with a countdown timer, and provides a “CONTINUE” button to proceed with the purchase, along with links to terms, privacy policy, and a restore option.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'New User Sale' menu item to navigate to the subscription purchase screen. Then, it proceeds to click the 'Monthly subscription tab' to select the Monthly subscription plan, completing the selection of the subscription option.

steps.summary: Click on 'New User Sale' menu item to navigate to the subscription purchase screen
Click on 'Monthly subscription tab' to select the Monthly subscription plan

FDG.function_description: The Settings page of the to - do list app enables users to configure various options such as account sync, widget settings, notification and reminder preferences, theme selection, calendar sync, task - related audio and subtask auto - completion settings, as well as date and time - related configurations like the first day of the week, time format, date format, and due date settings.

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a PRO upgrade page for the task management app, showcasing available PRO features (e.g., unlimited checklist, ad removal) and offering different subscription plans (Monthly, Permanent, Annual) with a limited-time special offer and a "CONTINUE" button to proceed with the upgrade.
